result.execSummary:
All charges against CHRISTOPHER E. GARLAND in this case have been dismissed. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. CHRISTOPHER E. GARLAND is presumed innocent.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. CHRISTOPHER E. GARLAND

records.addlTxt: Attorney Scott A Ceman in court for CHRISTOPHER E. GARLAND.  Prosecuting attorney Amanda Lynn Folger in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court is in compliance with Marsy's Law/Victim Rights.  State moves to dismiss w/o prejudice--proof issues.  No objections.  Court grants.
Motion hearing on October 5, 2022 at 09:15 am.
Motion hearing on September 20, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

10:38 AM Defendant CHRISTOPHER E. GARLAND in court with attorney Scott A Ceman.  David C. Rashid appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Information on file; acknowledge receipt.  Reading waived - plea entered.  Defendant's suppression motion on file.  Bond continues.  Motion hearing scheduled for September 20, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Motion to Suppress Warrantless Search of the Defendant's Bedroom

10:06 AM Defendant CHRISTOPHER E. GARLAND in court with attorney Scott A Ceman.  Tracy Ann Paider appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Testimony taken.  Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed.  Defendant bound over for trial.  Bond Continues.  The Court notes there is no victim present that wishes to make a statement.  Record closed @ 10:19.  Arraignment scheduled for June 27, 2022 at 10:15 am.

10:32 AM Attorney Scott A Ceman in court.  Adam Joseph Levin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  This case was set for Prelim today.  DE called the Clerk of Courts, said he fell and hit his head this morning, so he is still at home.  Attorney Ceman notes the DE is in a wheelchair.  Attorney Ceman does requests an adjourned PX date.  The State doesn't object to a new date, but notes they do have a witness here today.  Bond Continues.  The Court notes there is no victim present that wishes to make a statement.  Record closed @ 10:35.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 9, 2022 at 10:00 am.
